intro: Leptaulus vilhenae, commonly known as the Brazilian violet, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces showy, violet-colored flowers during the spring and summer months. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is adapted to thrive in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the Violaceae family, which includes other well-known genera such as Viola and Wisteria. Due to habitat loss, it is considered threatened and is often found in conservation programs aimed at preserving native flora.
